description:
Located in Presidio Heights on California Street, this Peet's is conveniently situated near UCSF Medical Center.

In the past, whenever I've decided to walk after work from downtown to my wife's work in this particular neighborhood, this Peet's would be one of my pit stops along the way. Walking is a great way of exercising; especially if you have a busy schedule. I'd start from Kearny and Market St. and take Geary until I arrive at Japantown and go up Fillmore to cross over to California from there. It takes me between 1 hour & 15 minutes average (give or take a few minutes) to reach her work depending on my pace. 

Reaching Peet's is like a landmark since I know I am close by, and I usually get a boost of energy....in a form of either a Javiva Coffee or a Cold Brew. 

What I also like about this location is they have a front entrance and a back entrance. They have a parking lot in the back, and most of the stores here have back entrances so it makes it convenient to go in and out of this place. If you happen to see someone you don't want to run into, you can get a quick getaway using the back entrance.

Just like any Peet's location, they're consistent and that's good enough for me.
author: John G.

description:
My drink today wa the organic "Gaia" which is typically smooth, full bodied with a taste that doesn't break down. I sweeten the brew with honey & usually add some almond milk.

1st taste not good, scary in fact. It tasted very acidic, and very oily. At first I thought it could be rancid milk. After a few startled sips I returned to the counter to let the server know. I asked for a small taste they dispense in those tiny cups. I asked it that was a bottom of the barrel serving etc. He told me it was fresh, he then gave me a new cup. It was the coffee, it wasn't as bad as the original cup but it was definitely different than what I'm used too. Maybe the vat was only longer than it should have been. Who knows? I've drank of enough of this stuff to know that it's off.

I then put in double the amount of sugar & milk I'd normally use. It made the proceeding ok; but I usually don't roll that way with my drink if that's what I'm having. All in all, no drama and that makes me happy.
author: Henry K.

description:
I went in and there was two baristas with customers at the "order drinks" section. There was another barista at the "order beans" section.

I thought there were two lines. One for the beans and one for the drinks so I stood waiting behind the two customers and two baristas. The one customer that was waiting near the order beans got called by that lady so I figured I was next.

While the two in front of me were being helped; a rush of people came in and stood in the 'order beans' line. I kind of started to have a feeling but none of the baristas in 'order drinks' looked at me (even though I was right to the side of their customers) and the 'order beans' lady seem to plow through that line. 

Then one of the two baristas in the 'order drink' left, leaving and empty spot and the guy barista looked at me, than looked at the line over by 'order beans' and said I can help you here.

Needless to say i left and went down the block to order from Starbucks. Where there's one line and I was in and out in two minutes. Reminds me why I've spent so much there that they've given me 11 free (or 125x11 stars worth) of food/drinks.
author: Whitne Y.

description: Stopped by while waiting for an appointment. It was pretty empty, especially compared to the large Starbucks down the street. The staff was nice and my matcha latte was fine, though maybe a little foamy. But the reason for the three stars is because the bathroom was in really bad shape - very dirty and stained floor, sink and toilet. The floor in the shop could have used a good sweep and mop too. I probably wouldn't have really noticed it, if not for the mess in the bathroom which made me feel unclean at the start, so it made me notice the spills, trash and sticky/empty simple sugar and milk station. Hoping this review gets them to clean up a bit to compete with the Starbucks.
author: Melanie N.

description:
We dropped in here to grab a quick breakfast beverage/snack before an errand. My mocha blended javiva was good, but they didn't have a good selection of savory items. The staff members were very friendly which was the best thing about this place. Wait time was decent for SF standards.

Main reason for 2 stars is their horrible shared men/women bathroom which was in bad shape and unapproachable.
author: Mia C.

description: I am not a big fan of coffee or tea, however, their salad is very good. I happened to stop by one time to get their saald, and I was amazed. Then I would randomly walk into a peets coffee to pick my salad for my lunch. I love doing my work here as well.
author: Missy P.

description:
I used to frequent this place from 2013-2015, when I was walking dogs twice a night. 
The (female)baristas are really nice, and the place was great for hanging out after work. Unfortunately, I'd always pay for what I ordered and left. Sometimes in life you have to keep on moving until satisfied.
author: Julio B.

description: As a customer, this Peet's is great! The only negative thing that can be said about this Peet's concerns the clientele. The customers here seem to think that the world revolves around them. Customers have rude, grumpy and just all around terrible attitudes. I come to this Peet's simply to have a cup of coffee and study. I would appreciate it if customers that come here, check their terrible attitudes at the door.
author: Tina B.

description: I can't stand coffee places that fill the entire cup of an iced beverage with ice. I got literally 4 sips of my drink before it was gone thanks to all the ice. I asked for a soy chai, not a $4 cup of ice.
author: Henry K.

description: The standard patrons here ... I mean, Peet's patrons. A little on the older side - and there's nothing wrong with it - I'm getting there myself! I can see already that in 50 years from now I'll be rolling my wheelchair at 6 in the morning into the neighborhood Peets, will take my usual corner spot near the window, slurp my coffee through my remaining teeth (it'll produce a weird, smacking noise) and stick my big nose into the last remaining newspaper on Earth, the New York Times, which the counter sells for $4.50.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Coffee was good. Came here Tuesday night (09.19) while.they were closing. Lost my green and black zipper wallet here. Checked un Wednesday but they said nothing turned in. Mgr was very nice. I will.give a reward, just want my stuff back. Will check is there is video capture, maybe someone found it. If you find it, please.send back to me. Reward.
author: Foo B.

description:
One of the older peets coffee places. Great employees. Great strong espresso drinks. Free parking in the back. 

Only downside is there is not a great amount of seating.
author: David G.

description: Very very nice staff and great place to get some work done. Coffee is great too. The staff went out of there way for a request I had. Thanks!!
author: Swati K.

description:
Alway good..alway prompt and smiling staff! Love Peet's Laurel village!
How about that food selection too!
author: Joanna T.

description: Slow service beyond belief. It's been my experience over the years that Peet's staff are smug and arrogant. Back to Starbuck's...
author: George V.

description:
This is where I get my beans on a Sunday morning in the rainstorm after my gal who made the coffee the PREVIOUS morning and had me run a buttload of shopping errands for her said nothing about us being out of coffee!! Ok rant over!!

So I jogged over to my Peet's in Laurel Village on a wet Sunday morning still half asleep.  I love that the ATM for Wells Fargo is right there (especially when you weren't expecting to have to go out in the rain and had no money in your wallet).  There was no line this morning because of the weather but when there is, the have a separate line for just beans where you have it ground to order.

When you buy whole beans you also get a complimentary cup of coffee or tea.  Not interested?  Get a rain check card for the future.  Of course I got a cup as my gal can get up and make her own coffee after making me schlep in the rain.

Now let me address some other comments made here. Before there was Starbucks with fancy names like Baristas and their half-caf mochachinos, there was Peet's.  Legend has it that the two founders were even partners but everyone tells a different story and I don't want to debate it here. Read about it on Wikipedia.

Peet's is San Francisco when it comes to coffee like Double Rainbow and its-it is to ice cream and Boudin is to bread.  True San Franciscans are snobs about those three things and will prefer them over the latest trends (Blue Bottle, Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocumb) and commercial stores (Starbucks, Coldstone, and Haagen-dazs).  Peet's and its employees do have an attitude.  It is laid back but more polite in some ways and rude in others.  As an old employee there once told me. Some people aren't awake yet, and the last thing they want is for me to be in their face with sunshine and smiles!  Also if you want to sit down for 3 hours and have a cup of mediocre coffee and do your homework and rudely occupy the seating area, you can go to the other end of Laurel Village to the 24 hour Starbucks which resembles more of a University Student Union in traffic and noise.

The two stores are a dichotomy and I'm told they are the two busiest for each chain in San Francisco (in fact some say this is the oldest store in the chain). They serve each clientele appropriately.  Today was definitely a Peet's morning.  I said less than 10 words, got my pound if coffee and free cup as well and was out in a few minutes and back reading my soggy Sunday paper in front of the fireplace.  My girl of course comes down and wonders why I didn't make her coffee already and upon seeing that I'm wet and already have a Peet's cup in my hand then asks if I got her a scone or ordered her a latte! Grrrrrr.
author: Erik H.

description: Very small, cramped, almost always unable to find a seat. Very loud and noisy.
author: Kyle R.

description: Nice crew but honestly it's the most uncomfortable coffee shop that ever existed. Tiny with heavy traffic. The company should move its crew into the larger Gymboree closing next door.
author: Alex H.

description: Ordered a medium latte.  $3.80 plus a $1.00 tip.  What I got in return was a medium size cup filled with over half with foam.   For $4.80, I'll go elsewhere.
author: B D.

description: The service is amazing . There was a problem in the back so the cashier had to leave for a couple minutes, ended up giving me a free drink  for the wait . I love the rich accent of wood in their building. The ambiance is active and social without being loud. Most customers are active runners  or going to work , which adds to the energy of the store.
author: Kevin T.

description: Love this Peets over the one on Geary & 17th .. The space feels bigger/less dingy. Staff is always great and I've never had a bad soy latte! Peets will always trump Starbucks in my book.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Good coffee as always. The coffee makers, however, are chatting to each other so much, that it is definitely lengthening the time it takes to get the coffee!

Sunday, November 22 at 9 am
author: Richard T.

description:
I'm a Peet's fan what can I say?

Great strong coffee
Lattes are also strong not too milky
Line can be long in the morning but moves moderately quick.

Pro tip: use their free lot in the back! Why do ppl pay for parking in front when it's free in the back?
author: Liz N.

description:
After a concert at Sharon Meadow in GG Park, we were looking for a place to get some coffee. We decided to head over to the Peet's in Laurel Village. 

Parking was easy in the large free parking lot in back of the shopping center. This Peet's is deep and narrow with entrances on California St and from the parking lot.  We were able to get our coffees and park ourselves in the one of the tables in the front. 

Fast and friendly baristas and $1 for refills when enjoying your dark, bold coffee on premises. Great Peet's location for your coffee needs.
author: Al L.

description: Pumpkin Latte is my very fav seasonal treat! Why Peet's Laurel Village? They rock. Busy place with long lines...staff really moves...hence, the line moves and everyone's happy. Not a lotta seating. Free Parking! Yay.
author: Miami S.

description:
Great coffee, as always, but staff is mixed.  This Peet's does an ok job at keeping things stocked.  They run out of creamer at the counter more than other locations but not as much as some.  I guess the thing that bothers me is they have to ask my name four years after I started going there.  It seems either staff turnover or else staff being traded between locations is the problem.  I've also had them make mistakes on my order semi-frequently.  This is usually caused by new hires who are gone a month later.  The regular staff are pretty friendly.  

The setup isn't great.  There's a huge amount of space behind the counter and almost no comfortable seating.  The few tables along the wall are right next to the line and not conducive for work or conversation.
author: Bucky P.

description:
I come here all the time to work, there are several tables but the design of this Peet's is so narrow you have to side shuffle to place your order, pick it up, get milk etc etc.

Overall, I like the amount of tables, the free (2 hour limit, pretty strictly enforced) parking in back, and the conveniently located Noah's Bagel's nearby. It's a decent place to get some work done on your laptop and ofcourse, far superior to Starbucks even with their fancy shmancy Clover machine.
author: Jess C.

description:
I see some mixed reviews. I agree that It can be a bit dirty but just the outside surrounding if you're entering the store from the back door. They keep the shop pretty clean inside.

It's pretty small compared to other Peet's but I think you can almost all the time find a spot to work or study if you need space for that. 

I come here almost ever morning for my almond latte and they are always consistent and the baristas are friendly!
author: Sarah K.

description:
Located in Laurel Village.  Convenient parking lot in the back with a back door entrance too.

Great coffee.  Great location.
author: Shirley N.

description: I wrote a review that detailed what happened with wayyyy too much whip put on top of my matcha green tea with almond milk blend..  Well, I guess they did something, thank you, because today they did it just like they used to.  Filled up the matcha green tea with almond milk, then just the right amount of a little whip on top.  Well done!  This is the Pete's that trained me not to eat too much of the whip, and it's about 1/5 the amount of what I complained about.  So thank you!  Glad to have you back!  (Works with my diet, too, thank you!)  This is a good Pete's and they have always had good employees, I guess they had one that was not yet trained!
author: Janet C.

description:
The baristas here are pretty much lazy and just stand around discussing midnight activities, well except for the older Asian lady who's been there forever. She's nice- the rest are pretty lame. Hard to tip when service is meh.......

The coffee's are always good and I love the lemon loaf slice.
Always a stop when on the rich side of town! I'm a Peetnik!
author: Lani J.

description: Very.rude cashier, the black guy with glasses was basically yelling at me while taking my order & he just threw my change on the counter! You call that customer service?
author: Lou C.

description: I always enjoy my peet's coffee! I find it to be consistent regardless of which location you go to! Plenty of parking at this location which is a huge plus in SF!
author: Lily M.

description: My beloved Peet's. Great seating here. This is a fantastic alternative to Starbucks down the street. I love the staff. They're always friendly. The only downside is the morning rush can make this a wait. I wouldn't come while people are making their morning commute, but ... MUNI express bus is just outside the shop. ;)
author: Andrew G.

description: I come in everyday before work. Love the staff at this place and they always make my drink exactly how I like it.
author: Shan M.

description:
This is for barista LANCE...LANCE if I'm taking time to peruse what's what, whether it's coffee beans or drinks, take the time to consider I'm moving at MY PACE NOT YOURS, especially during a time when there's one, old lady and myself buying something.  

I understand it might be a generational thing, but, do slow down if there's not a huge line of customers.  Your behavior can be interpreted as insensitive and just plain rude to come at a customer when they're simply taking their time to decide what they want.

Thanks for listening, Peet's Coffee.
author: Alacrity I.

description: Just went back to this Peet's place, and I have noticed that they have fixed the door so now customers can enjoy the seating for the upcoming winter without sitting there freezing. Good management, and thanks!
author: Morten H.

description:
Not a bad spot to take in a book or to do some light studying here.  The workers are generally friendly, and the baristas make the drinks decently well.  Quaint location in Laurel Heights though it can seem to get a bit too yuppy, but that comes with the territory so it's not to be unexpected.  Not an overwhelming amount of seats/tables since it's pretty narrow, but I haven't had a problem during the handful of times I've been here.  Certainly a lot less crowded than the Starbucks on the other side of the complex, but they have the advantage of being open late.  Plenty of parking in the back lot, as well as the street parking on California

Plus a half star for 2 hours of free wi-fi with a purchase, which is different than seemingly most local coffee shops where you still have to pay for it separately.
author: Mike L.

description:
I love Peet's, franchise that it is.  Deep, rich coffee and a conscience. 

Though I hate Laurel Village and luckily Peet's can be found all over the city.  Here is a perfect example of Laurel Village's pretentiousness.  Double park, block driveways, pull up on the curbs, just don't use the "free" parking lot in the back.  It isn't worth the trouble.
author: M M.

description: My go-to Peet's. Great crew here always on it for keeping the brew fresh and the best, honest friendly service. Tight for space if you're looking for a longer stopover, but parking in the back lot is free with extra neighborhood pkg if you feel like testing your karma.
author: Tristan C.

description:
Bought some great reduced pint glasses & coffee press. Despite being a Peetnik was unhappy with the Major Dickinson's on tap. Too use to grinding my own French or Italian. Bring back Viennese! 
Server nice & sweet, other customers mostly yuppies. SADLY had to go to nearby SB to pick up NYT : (
author: DeeAnn B.

description: I usually love Peet's, but the service is so painfully bad at this location that it's not worth going at all, even if you really really need coffee. The woman taking orders was actively mean, and there's a bitchy high school girl attitude amongst the staff. To top it off, my drink wasn't made right. Skip this Peet's altogether.
author: Belinda K.

description: Coffee is always good. Unfortunately there is no consistency in making a simple iced latte. I enjoy the foam and they continue to disappoint at this location. I'll be going to Starbucks in laurel village.
author: Melinda L.

description: I don't usually frequent chain coffee houses but I always make an exception with this location in Laurel Heights. Really friendly staff!
author: Michael K.

description: I am absolutely enjoying a Large Vanilla Latte at Peet's Coffee and Tea. The services are efficient and staff members are friendly. Overall, positive experience so I'll definitely come in for a coffee fix the next time I am in the area.
author: Bennett W.

description: Doctors, nurses, social X-rays, stroller pushers, wired seniors, baby boomers, baby deliverers, and me, all here to get our coffee fix on. And sometimes i'm not even the only black person here...or should I say coffee-colored?
author: Ted R.

description:
I can't believe I used to work here. I'm not sure what I loathed more, the yuppies or opening shifts on saturday mornings. Believe it, it's not fun when you're 15 and you wake up at the buttcrack of dawn to hop on the bus. 

This place is crowded, the service is okay and the barristas are decent but what really kills me is the yuppies.

YES I'M ASIAN, STOP STARING, I EFFING SPEAK ENGLISH.
author: Susy C.

description:
Theres a reason I don't go to this Peet's location and yesterday morning, on my way to work, I was made clearly aware why.

Just cuz its 7:30am on a saturday and you don't want to be at work means you have to have THE rudest customer service ever. A simple HELLO or THANK YOU would have been fine. But to the girl who took my order without a WORD  and then the older white haired lady who SO RUDELY told me where the line was (I KNOW where it is, im trying to see the menu for your stupid holiday drinks), a little kindness wont hurt.

I also took off multiple stars because my drink was nowhere near hot and was full of excessive caramel which i specifically said PLEASE don't give me. 

I wouldn't be so annoyed if maybe SOMEONE said have a nice day, or hello. Seeing as how I work in customer service myself, theres no excuse, its not that hard to use your words.

I'll stick to the Peets on 16th n Geary. THE nicest staff I've ever met in a coffee house EVER and my drinks are actually hot...
author: Diana R.

description: Clearly the most enjoyable place to be when getting coffee! Great vibe with incredible people waiting to greet you and start your day off right!!! To everyone at peet,s " thanks for kicking my day off right! " :0))
author: rick s.

description: I think the coffee from Peet's is always pretty good, yet at this location the surroundings are so filthy that I find it hard to enjoy. Also, the manager is always yelling and discussing non work issues with the staff. She also is really rude a lot of times and does not have management skills. If you look around, the windows are always filthy, the floors in the customer areas is filthy and behind the counter, where the coffee is being brewed,etc, it is always beyond filthy no matter the time of the day. Another thing I noticed is the cream/milk containers are always super dirty too. I avoid going there due to the lack of standards in terms of the cleanliness. It is just unacceptable and possibly a health risk.
author: Patufla P.

description: it's a peet's!  what can i say?  my coffee was delicious!  got some sort of amazing peppermint bark as a snack.  very quick and friendly service!  peet's kind of tend to be the same in my experience so far in the west, but i have relatives in the east who crave their stuff.  i know this will sound weird to san franciscans, but i swear my uncle, a commercial pilot, gets peet's beans every time he's on this coast.  good lattes that aren't just hot milk.  those are the worst.  not overcrowded.  idk.  i'm a fan of you, peet's.
author: maria f.

description: Great service, and yummy drinks!!  The space is a bit crowded so it's not ideal for hanging out, but perfect if you are buying on the run.
author: Bonnie B.

description: Great customer service I love coming in here before I have to go to work they make my day better with my cup of coffee
author: Sergio G.

description: I really love Peet's! The strong coffee, the global art and the fair trade interest and education of us consumers - all a thousand cuts above Star***ks! But in my heart of hearts and taste buds, what I love the most is the FOAM! And I have learned that quality of foam - real Peet's foam - depends on the training and commitment of the barista to uphold Peet's quality and standard for the best foam out there. When the barista puts the pitcher of milk under the steamer and goes off to do other things, the foam loses quality- doesn't get dry. Or as I was told by Roland just now, what I wanted is "bone" dry. So he remade my "bone dry" cappuccino...well, I wouldn't ask him to remake it twice - hence the yelp feedback. Please Peet's - do refresher foam training with your baristas so that you can maintain your thousand cut above! Thanks! Oh and some grain free unrefined pastries would be greatly appreciated too! Blessings!!!
author: T. S.

description:
I am so addicted to Peets coffee.  This one is located in the Laurel Heights section of SF and has the usual decor you will find at Peets.

Once again, I wish there were more seats and tables.  Perhaps they could fit bar stools and the accompanying tables along side the loooong counter.  We could watch the baristas complete our complex drinks and cheer them on!

Nice neighborhood to be in too.  Lots of people-watching opportunities.  "Order up!"
author: Derek N.

description:
Every Peet's delivers same sort of coffee experience. My review is for this Peet's mainly and my experience at this one, not so much the quality of coffee.

I walk by SB and Peet's everyday on my way to work. If I have time before work I grab a mocha or latte. It used to be SB for the idea that it is a quick in and out place. Nope! Not a chance. Several times I have spent 30 minutes waiting at 6am for a mocha. No bueño. 

Shortly after I discovered the glorious that is Peet's coffee, I realized I liked it waaaay better then SB and they are fast. Boy are they fast. I have been in line behind 10 people, 745am, and been out the door Large Mocha in hand in 5 minutes or less. And service with a smile. 

The staff are pretty fantastic. If I would be more awake I'd name names, but at that time of the day, I'm a zombie. They get me up and running almost every day and out the door quickly! For my money that is what I look for in my local coffee shop. They hit the mark.

The place is always pretty clean even during peak hours. Coffee orders are more then always perfect and accurate. Even when I slip and ask for a Grande or Venti. Blasphemy I know, but hey, "I'm conditioned, even my condition has been conditioned." They smile and take the order just the same. 

Even as I drop my head and slowly move away from the counter.
author: Benjamin W.

description: I always been a very loyal Peet's customer for close to well over 20 years, can say i've never had a bad cup of coffee here or ANY Peet's cofee shop for that matter. Plus the pastries are the best hands down over Starbuck!!!!
author: Wolfy W.

description:
every time i come in here, i have to wait forever, and they have more than once lost my order altogether and i have to remind them.  

so even tho i'm a peets fan, i dread coming here unless i absolutely have to.
author: Josie M.

description:
I worship Peet's coffee, it is my higher power 

This location always has parking behind the building, or right in front (metered in front, free behind)

I love the raspberry mocha, substitute for white chocolate, and it's a sweet treat in a cup
author: Noelle L.

description: Each and every person working at this location is so incredibly enjoyable and excellent at what they do -- thoughtful and balanced in how they approach situations, and just really a pleasure.  My fiance and I particularly enjoy:  Allison; and the guy who pulls his long-ish hair back; and the lady who knows a lot about products from the perspective of being trained as a chef.  I asked that lady about the vanilla beans they sell and she answered my question re how to make my tea taste vanilla-ish, involving throwing some bean shavings into my box of sweetener at home.  Vanilla stevia sweetener, who knew!  Also, Peet's has DELISH oatmeal.  Oh! And they just got in the cutest stocking stuffers and their new seasonal holiday / winter blend teas.
author: Amber G.

description: Best coffee, staff is almost always friendly and helpful, great atmosphere. Had a scone yesterday (3-13-13) that was terrible. Tasted undercooked. My friends' muffin was not much better. And this is not an anomaly, although I have had decent pastries in the past here. Come on Peet's, the prices are reasonable for high quality pastries, but not for this stuff.
author: Tucky D.

description:
There's more space now!
There's a barista here who makes me feel awkward and our exchanges are always awkward.

Burned my mouth from the coffee.
Pure love.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Pretty legit. Staff is awesome and friendly. I'm there almost everyday, and when I want to switch it up from my usual and ask for a recommendation, they have great suggestions.

Watch out for those strollers. The Laurel Moms can't navigate well.
author: Emily P.

description: This was my first time to their coffee bean bar and I was super impressed. Lauren was patient, informative, and accommodating. Free tea or coffee with purchase?! I'm never going back to Starbucks.
author: Mallory V.

description:
+1 Parking in the back
+1 At least two registers open at all times, so the line moves fast
+1 Quality baristas
+1 Very friendly staff
+1 Still have soymilk for public use, unlike other Peets in the city
-1 You won't feel like you fit in unless you're pushing a Baby Bjorn stroller
author: Rainer P.

description:
It's homey and one of my favorite stores. I love the staff, they're friendly and prompt. 

The seating area is a little crowded but works. The people and neighborhood it's in makes this store. 

Just wish there was more parking around.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Yesterday I watched the employee serving me wipe her nose on her arm while she was getting my coffee and she came back to the register coughing. This morning (7am) there was only one register open. With five people in line the employee at the register turns around and takes several minutes to pour more grounds in and brew coffee. When there are 4 other employees who could be doing that. And no other registers open. And people waiting. I really don't want to start drinking Starbucks but...
author: Tobias P.

description:
We dropped in at Peet's in Laurel Village on Saturday.  The line was long, but it moved fast.  We sat in the window ... Margaret commented on a beautiful baby in a stroller on the sidewalk outside the window, and it woke up long enough to look at her.  Are humans telepathic?  

I tried the gingerbread nonfat latte.  Sweet!
author: David D.

description:
I have a lot of love for this Peet's. I probably go there 4 mornings a week and most of the folks working there know not only my drink, but the two or three different ways I order. 

At first I was like, "are these people judging me?" but then I realized they just have a cool efficiency about them, which I really admire. A nice staff all the way around, and believe me, the local clientle is a handful, I'm sure.

No way could the staff at that Petuluma Peet's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/IAS8bJ_IDezC7idHaheCzA#hrid:xGapTAlLbHDf4HMEbMMcfg) serve this location.

Katherine, Loan, Joel, Susan and the rest of you: You guys rock!
author: Jason R.

description: Yummmayyy, caramel latte was delish! Dare I say better than Starbucks!
author: Dana S.

description:
Peet's coffee is fine.

This location: Kids, kids, more kids, kids pushing each other and screaming so loud that I can't place my order.
author: Chrissy L.

description:
I like that i'm only across the way from this Peet's and I'd be damned if I was a coffee-holic and my bank account would suffer. I love their mochas and they make it just right! A little tart then soothe it with some sweetness. I came here yesterday afternoon around 4:30pm and I noticed how low key and chill it is here but there is some lack of seating on the inside. I assume, based on reading other's reviews, that it can be quite chaotic which is probably normal for any good coffee shop. 

Service was great, no lines, double checked on my order, very friendly, and made sure they got my name right but some people suck at pronouncing which i have become accustomed to. Oh well. And thank goodness there weren't any kids in there otherwise i'd slap their mother and tell her to tie them to the parking meters if they don't control them. Other than that my experiences here have been flawless :)
author: Marie G.

description: The staff forgot my order. We ordered five drinks and forgot one. They finally made my drink after i asked them whats going on. They finally made it after waiting for 10 minutes. Need to be more organized
author: Deadted D.

description:
Best Coffee ever!

This is better than water-down Starbucks, and Tully's.

It goes Peet's, Tully's and last Starbucks. The coffee here is awesome. I got free fresh beans today b/c it's their 40th year anniversary. Great for local caffiene fix and hanging out with friends. Starbucks is overrated. Their coffee isn't that great. But Peet's is the BOMB!
author: Stanley K.

description:
I love Peet's coffee - In my opinion, they know how to do coffee, always hot, always strong and always the way I want it.

The Laural Village location gets super busy, and the customer base isn't always so polite.  I always appreciate the folks who work behind the counter because of the a$$h*les they deal with day in and day out.

They do need a larger location, one with plenty of stroller parking =P
author: Christy L.

description: late in day hot chocolate was well deserved by my hungry self needing something to hold me over until dinnner. did you know a cup of hot chocolate isn't toooo high in calories if you take to the streets daily running hopping and skipping! employees have nice manners saying please and thank you. not once has an employee grabbed money out of my hand. never has an employee thrown my change back at me either, they politely place all coins in hand and hand me my beautiful hot chocolate ready to drink. did i tell you tuesday is my favorite day to drink hot chocolate?
author: Sin D.

description: When you need some strong ass coffee in the morning, Peet's is definitely your place to go. None of that sugar-in-everything Starbucks bullshit. That's amateur shit. You don't need coffee. You just want a slight taste of it with hella cream and syrup. Everything here tastes stronger...even their teas I feel like has more of a stronger, bitter, blacker TEA taste than anywhere else. I hear their caramel lattes and their vanilla lattes are good but I only go for one thing here and that's their drip coffee. I'm a creature of habit so I don't really want to try other drinks. Plus lattes are more expensive and my cup of small coffee that I literally sip for an entire 8 hr workday and STILL have a problem finishing it sometimes..is $1.80. Enough said. Oh yeah and their pastries are all yummy =)
author: Elaine L.

description: I have tried numerous brands of coffee and I keep coming back to Peets.Although the lines can be long what really stands out in my experience is that they have good customer service that is polite, helpful and attentive.
author: Victoria S.

description: Poor customer service.  I asked what their non-dairy options were and the lady just looked at me like I was mentally incompetent to understand that they just have soy. Like yo, I know it's the end of your shift or whatever, but there's no need for the attitude. I probably won't return to this location because the mood is so cold in here.
author: k h.

description: I love Peet's coffee, but this location is one of my favorite.  All the people who work here are so nice and friendly.  They remember your name or face or even your favorite drink!!
author: David O.

description:
So maybe I went on an off day...

I was at a class and dropped by for some tea.  Both employees were in their early 20's, if even that. 1 cashier was grinding coffee up and another was making drinks.  3 people ahead of me and for 5 minutes, none of us was acknowledged.  One person finally yelled out "are we gonna get service anytime soon?", which got the attention of the female Asian barista who responded back "Yes" and went back to making a drink.  She was really rude to 3 other customers, telling one even to "make up your mind."  

The tea and scone were good.  I called the manager and definitely hats to him for even offering me a free drink next time I'm in.
author: Samantha L.

description:
This Peet's location has the nicest Batista's in San Francisco!  

I have a big problem with attitude before I caffeinate.  The sweat hearts who work at the Peet's in Laurel Village make my mornings a little bit easier and for that, I love them.
author: eric f.

description:
I've been here a bagillion times, but I will just tell about my latest experience:
1~ Order a small, nonfat latte under my name.
2~ Order a vegan chocolate chip cookie.
3~ Eat the cookie while I'm waiting for my coffee.
4~ Satisfied, but not amazed with cookie.
5~ Coffee comes out under the name "Pat," =not my name
6~ Drink Pat's coffee because that's what the employee tells me to do
7~ Enjoy coffee in which I added cinnamon, coacoa, syrup
8~ Leave happy.
author: Juju B.

description:
This is definitely my favorite Peet's. Everyone that works there is cool, except for one dude that I've nicknamed "Dutchie". He always looks a little angry, and has a shitty attitude. It's like he's having a permanent bad day. Whatever.

Most of the baristas here are pretty damn good, but KT is the master of the espresso bar. If he's working, you're in luck.
author: Alex C.

description: I really like peets tea but I regret that the place is SO DIRTY! The floor needs mopping and windows need a good cleaning! I cannot enjoy my coffee in a dirty place!
author: Anastasia M.

description:
I think it's the best place for a cup of coffee in the Laurel Village shopping area. Most times the staff is pretty friendly (in my experience its the morning crew) and since I'm not there with a billion other people at the same time it's a nice place to sit on a bench and watch the people stroll by.

It's not fantastic but, hey it has a good consistency and it's not Starbucks.
author: J B.

description:
This has to be on the top of my chain coffee shops.  I love the afternoon crew.  They are mellow and you can joke around with them.  Just what you need at that time of day.  I love how Peets just give you that jolt of caffeine and flavor in a small cup of happiness.  ahhh...I can still taste it.  It's beautiful.  

And for those who drink Starbucks...HAH!  Until you can handle a cup of Peets, you are not a true coffee drinker.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Clean, spacious, and 1 hr free Wi-Fi with a purchase. The guy was pretty nice and said if I needed another hour just to let him know. 

Love the iced vanilla lattes!
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
It's been said; but I shall say it again: I love Peet's.
For my money, it is the best coffee I have had outside of places that coffee grows. I like Peet's more than coffee in France or Italy.  I love Peet's.  Their Garuda blend is my fav. For a few extra bucks try the Arabian-Mocha Sunani, it's small fragrent beans are divine. 
They also have some of the best tea around.
author: k g.

description:
Their drip coffee is weak(I don't get why my bro in law likes this place over Starbucks coffee). Their blended beverages is sad...have you ever tasted the little specks of coffee beans or whatever was in the drink or was it an additional ingredient? Anyways, it was BAD@!
The Chai Lattte I tried was like water with some sugar and spice.
The only decent thing I order from now on is the Ice Tea and a piece of lovely chocolate croissant.
author: Club G.

description:
Consider my rating a 4.5.

I love Peet's.  And this is the closest one to me.  Good, bold coffee is hard to find.  Their espresso drinks are also very hot (which is how I like it), and loaded with flavor.

The only downside (and maybe this applies to this particular location), is that it takes a couple minutes longer to get my drink compared to Schultzbucks.  This has happened more than a few times, but I let it slide because the service is really friendly...and the coffee is awesome.
author: Ash C.

description: The staff at this location is particularly friendly, and they offer a free cup of the daily special when you buy a pound or more of beans, which is a nice touch. Who needs a humongo iced, non-fat, decaf, soy-milk mochafrappacrappaccino with service like that?
author: Gourmet G.

description: Pretty much the only Peet's (aside from "Trader Peet's" in SOMA) to get less than a 4-star average.  And yet, this is actually one of the better Peet's coffee-wise (of the 11 I've tried, anyway:) .  So what gives?  Well, put it this way: I came here at 9:15 AM on a Tuesday, figuring it'd be pretty empty since, you know, nobody works in *Laurel Heights*, right?  Well, what I forgot was that *nobody works* in Laurel Heights. Consequentially, you're liable to find more double strollers in here than double mochas. (Bada-bum!  Can I have a job on SF Mag's Street Date column now?)  No really, Noe's got nothing on the Lo-Hi mom crowd (case in point: The Ark toy store).  So you're liable to find a line at any time of day.  Not a lot of seating inside, it's all about the precious sidewalk tables to watch the "Laurel Village" bustle and hum.  (Of course, if you want the full LH experience, try Rigolo a few doors down).
author: Wes M.

description: Yep, I used to live in the Outer Richmond and work in FiDi.  So, IF I got a ride to work, I'd see if we could just swing by and grab a quick cup of coffee at the Laurel Village Peet's.  Now that I no longer live in Richmond district nor work in FiDi, I still stop by when I'm visiting friends on that side of SF.  Quick grab of Peet's coffee and visit to the fishmonger if they are open (not open on Sunday, one of the two days I'd possibly go to Laurel Village) and perhaps a stroll along the stores.  Then back to the car, and to the next activity.
author: Patty W.

description: This is my favorite Peet's. I always get treated very well here. The service is excellent and the coffee is great. I have never gotten a bad latte from here. They don't over roast their beans like most other places so the excellent flavor of the espresso is actually able to come out. The one downside to this place is that you really can't go here and hang out. This is really more of a Peet's problem than the Laurel Village Peet's, but it's there nevertheless. Bottom line: when I want a really good latte, I go here. I know I can park and I know that it will be good.
author: Erik S.

description: Same review anytime, antwhere... PEET"S ROCKS!
author: Rachel L.

description: One of my favorite Peet's...I like the windows up front where you can people watch the Laurel Heights crowd, which usually has plenty of dogs, little kids, and people freaking out trying to catch the bus there at the corner.  Not enough seating overall though, which is the one flaw common to all Peet's.
author: Kevin S.

description: Back in the day when I lived in San Francisco I worked at this Peet's. Yes, this was the location of my personal interaction with Tom Waits.  He ordered a pound of coffee ( I wish I could remember which kind) and declined the free cup that went with it. I also served Peter Coyote some java one time as well...enough about my brushes with greatness... This is a good, old fashioned Peet's made with tons of real wood before the company grew and started to spend less on the materials they use in their stores....great place to work, in general great customers accepting those who arrive at 7:30am experiencing caffeine withdrawal attempting to order  the most complicated drink, ever, when they can barely put sentences together....yikes!  Lots of baby strollers, huge dogs and people in a hurry but where won't you find that these days.
author: Rebecca B.

description: Since Crossroads is not by work, I opt for Pete's. They usually do a fair job on my dry cappuccino and the cherry oatmeal bars are addictive, but these strange mothers who think it is cute to tie up an entire establishment with their out-of-control kids in Mercedes strollers can make this place a bit of a challenge.
author: Robert M.

description: I don't know what they do to the coffee that makes it do what it does to me but I like it! I have yet to find coffee that wakes me up as fast and for as long as Peet's does. Unfortunately, I can't quite replicate the feeling when I make it at home; it doesn't energize me as fast. The line can get a little ridiculous in the mornings. Fortunately, the staff is an inspiration in the morning. They're all friendly and engaging and help you to start the day with a positive attitude.
author: Richard S.

description: I am not one to support chains, but what can I say, these guys make my high-maintenance foo-foo drink just how I want it, especially Haley, Josie, Jenna and Anthony (I won't order a cappucino unless I see him behind the bar).  I sure hope this store appreciates what great "artisan" (lol) baristas they have, and the cashiers are friendly too.  They are fast and do the job right.  Until they invent a fancy Italian name for my Americano with foam, and until a Mom and Pop place I find can make it right, I will shamefully keep giving my hard-earned skrill to Peet's in Laurel Village.  Give them a raise with your price increases, Mr. Peet!
author: jessica f.

description: The line can get long, but I've always found it to move fairly quick; service is usually fast and friendly.  I like to call this place a grab-and-go, as there aren't enough chairs to go around for people who want to hang around and leisurely sip their coffee.  (Then again, if you can't snag a window seat, you can also try to catch the dog/stroller/people-watching action on Laurel Village up close from the bench outside.)  This location was near my last workplace, and though I wasn't a huge coffee drinker back then, when I really needed a pick me up in the morning (or afternoon), I could always count on Peet's.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Grew up in the east bay, so I have a little bit of a preference to Peet's of the branded formula coffe guys. But of all of the locations, the Laurel Heights cafe is my favorite. Especially great for peoplewatching, there is always an eclectic stream of people walking through.
author: Tanya P.

description: I adore peets coffee and the folks at this location get the job down. They almost always make my foam perfect and they reccommend good espresso beans to go :)
author: Kyla L.

description: Alright, so I DESPISE Peet's coffee - it's WAY too...burnt-tasting for me!  I can't stomach it.  But since I've now given up coffee, a lovely date of mine brought me some Peet's hibiscus tea, and it was *delish*.  I got a hibiscus lemonade cooler here, and they were friendly and dealt with me being overwhelmed by the menu, since I've basically not stepped foot in one in years.  I'm a fan, even if I don't visit often.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is my coffee go to.  Granted the line on the weekend is INSANE, would it kill you to have a few more people working?  I have even mentioned this to them, hello, they are a client of ours and still nothing.  Oh, one can dream can't they?  The raspberry scone is very tasty, as at the croissants.  Skip the currant scone as what's the point, there is no fruit in there.   If you go at an off time, you are golden, but buyer be advised, the weekend a mid-morning is baby and stroller central.  If the wee things are not your scene, then i advise to go elsewhere.
author: Nicole F.

description: The product here is good, it is the Bay Area (Berkeley) version of Starbucks.  Similar products, but often gets the benefit of the doubt here because it is "home grown."  You get the same type of crowd at both, the one difference is that Peet's is more consistent with what they give to their customers.  It is a corporation too, so this nonsense that Starbucks is that bad guy because it is big business is BS, so is Peets.  Good coffee, and more consistent!
author: matt g.

description: KT is the man i go to. the team there is definitely friendly and always remembers the customer. The coffee is great!
author: jacqueline c.

description: This PEET's is my favorite!!!!   Efficient, friendly staff.  They appreciate the customer.  Clean surroundings.  This is what all PEET's should strive to be!!!!  Great  job!!!!
author: skipper a.

description: peet's is good, peet's is fine, i go to peet's all the time.  but after my experience with one of the barrista's at the laurel village peet's -susan  i think was her name, i will NOT be going back to this particular peet's in the near future.  i think that she is a reincarnated kindergarten teacher from 1950-that's her tone, very bossy.  i don't need to put up with her attitude for my $5 latte.
author: sarah b.

description: This Peet's in Laurel Village is the best Peet's that I have visited in the Bay Area. It has the absolute best service with a friendly attitude shared by the customers. I have lived in Mill Valley for thirty years and I always wait until I go to SF to get my package of coffee at this Peet's. In a pinch I go to the Peet's in Corte Madera, which is also great. The Peets near where I live in Mill Valley is the worst, which has an unfriendly and rude group of customers and an arrogant ,indifferent attitude delivered with your coffee by those who work there. Morning, noon or evening the best Peets is in Laurel Village.
author: monjett g.

description: If I have to support a chain, it's Peet's all the way.  Their coffee rocks, and can keep me awake through my 12 hour days.  My first time in, I almost walked out due to the L O N G line, but it moved damn fast.  I actually enjoy all the different folks who come through here, the runners, the mommies with strollers, the cops, students, and hospital folks.  I just wish they had more room to park those strollers and laptops.  I figure they make it really uncomfortable so that people will just grab their coffee and go.  The should definitely offer similar hours to that other coffee joint on the corner.
author: Christine H.

description: man....all i wanted was a cup of coffee this morning on my way to work. see i was running a little late, so i couldn't stop at my usual spot (they're a little slow, but the coffee is damn good at the village market!). so i stopped at peet's. so ya, it's a saturday morning in laurel heights....the strollers were out in abundance, the gym clothes were on, and the neighborhood peeps were out on the town.....so it's finally my turn....i'm still good on time. i order my coffee....so ok here's where you all are going to laugh at me but i don't care....i order my small decaf coffee....ya i said decaf. you think i want to drink decaf? talk to my anxiety ridden self! so i order my decaf coffee......and the barista goes to the coffee pot.....in slow motion mind you....and then slowly turns around and says, we are out of decaf, but if you want to wait a minute and a half (her EXACT words. a minute and a half) it'll be on the house....i look at my watch. sure i've got a minute and a half. so she strolls, no she moves at a snails pace to the coffee bar. has a minute and a half conversation with a fellow peet's barista. realizes that there aren't any decaf coffee beans ground, so she once again snail crawls to the coffee bar and pours the  beans in....has another lovely conversation with another barista, then pushes the grind button......we are at about 3 minutes now.....then she goes over to the coffee pot and pours in the beans and then she stops to take a order , THEN she pushes brew!!! we are at five minutes now with the minute and a half brew time still left.....i'm pissed. i leave. with no coffee....starting work on a saturday morning without coffee is not fun. i think i'm still mad i didn't get my coffee today. arrrgggghhhh!!!! well, at least i'll sleep well. peet's i'm pissed!
author: Teri A.
